newsitem.title: GREECE: LIST OF GREEK TELECOM OTE PRICE CHANGES FOR '97.
newsitem.headline: LIST OF GREEK TELECOM OTE PRICE CHANGES FOR '97.

text.p: The following is a list of price changes announced by Greece's state telecom OTE, effective January 1, 1997:
- The new telephone connection fee is cut to 40,000 drachmas from 50,000, down by 20 percent.
- The basic monthly fee, regardless of calls, rises to 1,850 from 1,650 drachmas, up by 12.12 percent.
- The local three-minute call rises to 11.5 drachmas from 10.2, up by 12.75 percent.
- Long distance calls within Greece are cut by 1.78 percent on the average. The four-zone charging system is changed to a three-zone system, eliminating the fourth and most expensive zone altogether.
- International calls to Europe rise by seven percent.
- International calls to United States, Canada, Australia are cut by 18 percent.
- Hellascom network service fees are hiked by 10 percent.
- Hellaspak network fees are cut by 15 percent.
